timeline.bodyText:
Python-experimental uses some python templates to generate python code and selectively uses the python-experimental templates one level deeper. Our code assumes that the entry point is the python templates folder and we manually point to the python-experimental deeper templates when needed:
https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/blob/master/modules/openapi-generator/src/main/java/org/openapitools/codegen/languages/PythonClientExperimentalCodegen.java#L135
Why have you changed this?
If you want to only have a python-experimental template folder that is fine. To do that one would need to:

copy over the remaining missing python templates into the python-experimental templates folder
update https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/blob/master/modules/openapi-generator/src/main/java/org/openapitools/codegen/languages/PythonClientExperimentalCodegen.java#L129 to add all the required python-eXperimental templates

Could that change be in a separate PR to make it easier to review if you want to make that change?
timeline.author: spacether

replies.bodyText: This was just misunderstanding on my part.  That it's overridden within the generator makes perfect sense.
replies.author: timgclark

replies.bodyText: So can you revert this change ;p?
replies.author: spacether

replies.bodyText: I saw this came back in along with the black changes - this was easy, but took some doing to get the diff happy on black.
replies.author: timgclark

timeline.bodyText: Thank you for this fix! I missed this when I switched python-experimental to using classname.
timeline.author: spacether

timeline.bodyText:
Any chance of moving your black updates into a separate PR?
It will make it easier to review.
timeline.author: spacether

replies.bodyText: Yes - black updates were accidental, will pull those out.
replies.author: timgclark

timeline.bodyText:
So some of the files in the test directory have real tests.
We see that this method test_create_instances has a manually written test in it.
This update is deleting those real tests.
Please preserve them?
timeline.author: spacether
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -41,130 +34,12 @@ def setUp(self):
     def tearDown(self):
         pass
 
-    def test_create_instances(self):

replies.bodyText:
Let me take a stab at cleaning this up as well.
I want to open a seperate core issue around this in general.  The fact that we both commit the model tests and don't regenerate model tests when present masked this issue for me.  (This is neither a huge priority, nor is there a single obvious fix for it)
replies.author: timgclark

replies.bodyText:
Can I suggest a fix? This has come up a couple of times.
How about:

Moving these manually written tests into the tests folder. That tests folder stores manually written tests only.
Renaming the tests folder something like tests_manual

I am asking the other members of the core team for guidance on how to most cleanly delete our auto-gen tests folder.
My understanding is that tests are only regenerated if they are not present in the test folder.
So because we already have the files there, they were untouched.
replies.author: spacether

replies.bodyText: I pulled out all but one of the sample test changes.  Seeing that we have both the generated test stubs and real tests, I'm not sure how much value there is in keeping all of the stubs up to date.
replies.author: timgclark

replies.bodyText: Missed that last round of suggestions - let me take a run at that.
replies.author: timgclark

replies.bodyText:

samples/openapi3/client/petstore/python-experimental/test/test_shape.py

samples/openapi3/client/petstore/python-experimental/test/test_gm_fruit.py
samples/openapi3/client/petstore/python-experimental/test/test_fruit.py

Regenerated all tests in the test directory.
Squashed everything down to one commit - I hated to do it, but the reason some of the tests were generating incorrectly was drift from master since I started working on this more than a week back.
replies.author: timgclark

replies.bodyText:
Thank you very much!
Squashing is fine here
replies.author: spacether

timeline.bodyText:
I see this change in the samples but not in the mustache file.
Did you run black on the sample results manually?
If so CI will fail because the branch contents disagree with the CI file contents and there will be uncommitted changes.
If we want these black changes, they must be applied to our mustache files to have them show up in the samples.
CI automatically regenerates samples and will wipe out any code changes written there that happened after generation.
timeline.author: spacether
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -77,78 +74,61 @@ def __any_key(
                     If the method is called asynchronously, returns the request
                     thread.
             """
-            kwargs['async_req'] = kwargs.get(
-                'async_req', False
+            kwargs["async_req"] = kwargs.get("async_req", False)
+            kwargs["_return_http_data_only"] = kwargs.get(
+                "_return_http_data_only", True
             )
-            kwargs['_return_http_data_only'] = kwargs.get(
-                '_return_http_data_only', True
-            )
-            kwargs['_preload_content'] = kwargs.get(

-            )
-            kwargs['_request_timeout'] = kwargs.get(
-                '_request_timeout', None
-            )
-            kwargs['_check_input_type'] = kwargs.get(
-                '_check_input_type', True
-            )
-            kwargs['_check_return_type'] = kwargs.get(
-                '_check_return_type', True
-            )
-            kwargs['_host_index'] = kwargs.get('_host_index')
+            kwargs["_preload_content"] = kwargs.get("_preload_content", True)
+            kwargs["_request_timeout"] = kwargs.get("_request_timeout", None)
+            kwargs["_check_input_type"] = kwargs.get("_check_input_type", True)
+            kwargs["_check_return_type"] = kwargs.get("_check_return_type", True)
+            kwargs["_host_index"] = kwargs.get("_host_index")
             return self.call_with_http_info(**kwargs)
 
         self.any_key = Endpoint(
             settings={

-                'auth': [
-                    'api_key',

-                ],

-                'http_method': 'GET',
